components.name: Customer Support Center
components.description: This includes services related to reaching support via phone, email, and chat.

incidents.name: SMS Delivery Issue Towards Claro Networks in Nicaragua, Honduras and Guatemala

incident_updates.body: We are still experiencing SMS delivery delays when sending messages to multiple Claro networks in Nicaragua and Guatemala. However, delivery issues affecting the Claro network in Honduras have been resolved. Our engineers are actively working with our carrier partner to address the remaining issues. We will provide another update in 16 hours or sooner if additional information becomes available.

affected_components.name: CARRIER NETWORK - SMS, Latin America

incident_updates.body: We are still experiencing SMS delivery delays when sending messages to multiple Claro networks in Nicaragua and Guatemala. We will provide another update in 8 hours or sooner if additional information becomes available.

incidents.name: Increase in Voice Call Disconnects in Flex 2.13.x for the Flex Accounts Using SSOv2

incident_updates.body: We have detected an increase in voice call disconnects for Flex agents on Flex 2.13.x for the Flex accounts using SSOv2. Engineering teams are investigating. We will update in 24 hours or when more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Small Number of Voice Calls Are Failing Stir/Shaken Attestation

incident_updates.body: We are observing recovery in issue that is causing a small number of Voice calls to fail Stir/Shaken Attestation. Due to this issue, these voice calls are getting signed as Attestation C. We will continue monitoring the service to ensure a full recovery. We will provide another update in 8 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

affected_components.name: PROGRAMMABLE VOICE - Voice REST API

incident_updates.body: We are observing recovery in issue that is causing a small number of Voice calls to fail Stir/Shaken Attestation. Due to this issue, these voice calls are getting signed as Attestation C. We will continue monitoring the service to ensure a full recovery. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

affected_components.name: PROGRAMMABLE VOICE - Voice REST API

scheduled_maintenances.name: Twilio Flex - Maintenance

incident_updates.body:
Were conducting a planned maintenance in all regions between 9:00 PM PST to 11:59PM Pacific Time on 07/29/2025. During the maintenance window, the team will be migrating data to the new cluster. There will be two cluster reboots (about 10 seconds each) during this time. Customers may experience the following during the two cluster reboots:

-Login failures for customers logging in via legacy SSO (customers with enhanced SSO are not impacted) or console.

-Customers that are already logged in may be logged out from Flex UI or webchat.

-Customers using webchat may be unable initiate new sessions or see disruptions to their existing sessions (token refresh failure).

Customers should be able re-login after the impact period in case of login failure during the maintenance window.

scheduled_maintenances.name: Japan Voice Carrier Partner Maintenance

incident_updates.body:
Our Voice carrier partner in Japan is conducting a planned maintenance from 07 August 2025 at 06:00 PDT until 07 August 2025 at 11:30 PDT. During the maintenance window, there could be intermittent call disconnects or call failures from and to Twilio Japan phone numbers for a maximum duration of 100 minutes per block.

This maintenance will impact approximately 6000 phone numbers and downtime will occur in one of the following blocks depending on the applicable national (050) number:

Downtime 1: 22:00 JST August 7 (06:00 PDT August 7) for 100 minutes
Downtime 2: 00:00 JST August 8 (08:00 PDT August 7) for 100 minutes
Downtime 3: 02:00 JST August 8 (10:00 PDT August 7) for 70 minutes

For any inquiries about your impacted phone numbers time slots, please reach out to your Twilio Account Manager or create a ticket via https://help.twilio.com/submit
